result.execSummary:
The defendant Lem M Wells was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 10/28/2015 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.
Court WAIVED DNA sample due to offense date being before 4/1/2015.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lem M Wells

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lem M Wells in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.   

VETERAN COURT
Based upon the defendant's compliance with Veterans Treatment Initiative Court, court finds the agreement is fulfilled.  Defendant is awarded with a Certificate and a medallion of completion of Veterans Treatment Initiative.

AS TO COUNT 1 AMENDED
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Theft, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(d), a Class A Misdemeanor.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 2 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days served; this is a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 10/28/2015 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Court WAIVED DNA sample due to offense date being before 4/1/2015.

Defendant Lem M Wells in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

VETERAN COURT

Defendant Lem M Wells in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Brad A Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

VETERAN COURT
Court held colluquy with the defendant.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Veterans Treatment Initiative Court DPA matter adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ellen Brostrom, Branch 06.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Lem M Wells in court with attorney Barbara K. Due.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brostrom, Branch 06.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Review hearing scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Court appearance in Room 310 Safety Building on 4/2/14 @ 9:30am
